questions.questionText: What is the correct syntax to create a variable in Java?
questions.explanation: In Java, variables are declared with: datatype variableName = value; For example: int age = 25;

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT a primitive data type in Java?
questions.explanation: String is a reference type, not a primitive type. Primitive types in Java are: byte, short, int, long, float, double, boolean, and char.

questions.questionText: What is method overloading in Java?
options: Creating multiple methods with same name but different parameters
questions.explanation: Method overloading allows multiple methods with the same name but different parameter lists (different number or types of parameters).

questions.questionText: What is the time complexity of accessing an element in an array by index?
questions.explanation: Array access by index is O(1) because arrays provide direct memory access using the index.

questions.questionText: Which data structure is best for implementing recursion?
questions.explanation: Stack is used for recursion because function calls follow LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle - the most recent call must finish first.

questions.questionText: What is the worst-case time complexity of Quick Sort?
questions.explanation: Quick Sort has O(n²) worst-case complexity when the pivot is always the smallest or largest element, but average case is O(n log n).

questions.questionText: Who is known as the 'Father of Computer Science'?
questions.explanation: Alan Turing is considered the father of computer science and artificial intelligence. He developed the concept of the Turing machine.
CPU stands for Central Processing Unit - it's the main component that executes instructions in a computer.

questions.questionText: Which programming language was developed by James Gosling?
questions.explanation: Java was developed by James Gosling at Sun Microsystems in the mid-1990s.
HTTP stands for HyperText Transfer Protocol - it's the foundation of data communication on the World Wide Web.

questions.questionText: Which keyword is used to inherit a class in Java?
questions.explanation: The 'extends' keyword is used for class inheritance in Java. Example: class Child extends Parent

questions.questionText: What is the difference between == and .equals() in Java?
questions.explanation: == compares object references (memory addresses), while .equals() compares the actual content/values of objects.

questions.questionText: In a binary search tree, what is the maximum number of children a node can have?
questions.explanation: In a binary search tree, each node can have at most 2 children: a left child and a right child.

questions.questionText: What is the space complexity of merge sort?
questions.explanation: Merge sort requires O(n) extra space for the temporary arrays used during the merging process.

questions.questionText: Which year was the World Wide Web invented?
questions.explanation: The World Wide Web was invented by Tim Berners-Lee in 1991 while working at CERN.
